Looking at the exception, it seems that when the error occured, fewer RSE plugins were loaded than when Dave tried to reproduce it. 

The Platform AdapterManager only returns adapters when the corresponding AdapterFactory is already known (and the plugin which contributes the adapter factory is started). We should check plugin dependencies, what adapter is needed and where it is provided.

A solution with contributing adapter factory through plugin.xml, and using Platform.getAdapterManager.loadAdapter() could perhaps be used similar to what we are doing in org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core/Activator, with the adapters registered in org.eclipse.rse.files.ui.
Moving to 2.0.1. Does not require an api change or new PII.
